newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Work starts on new Schiphol Express building.
newsitem.headline: Work starts on new Schiphol Express building.

text.p: Work has started on Schiphol Express Property's new building, due to open in early 1998, a company statement said.
Based at the airport's new freight area -- Cargo World Schiphol Southeast -- the property comprises a 37,000 sq m site, including 20,000 sq m of warehousing and 8,000 sq m of office space.
Schiphol Express is the first logistic provider to establish itself at the Southeast freight area although freight forwarder KDS Air BV was the first company to be based there.
The company said it will take care of the handling and transport of airfreight for forwarders and freight companies.

It added that 25 of its customers will be based in the new building including Burlington, Concordia International Forwarding and Danzas International as well as Panalpina World Transport and its recently acquired Dutch unit, ChartAir Europe BV.
The new premises are in the area of Schiphol Southeast reserved for "second line" businesses, including forwarders and logistic providers as well as storage and distribution.
First line businesses are near the apron in an area reserved for freight handling and currently Avia Presto and Lufthansa Cargo are based there.
